datangraphics

Class DatanGraphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • datangraphics.DatanGraphics

  • public final class DatanGraphics
extends java.lang.Object
    A final class with methods to produce graphics.
    Author:
    Siegmund Brandt.

      Returns a number with the sign of x and somewhat smaller than x with only few significant digits; method is used for automatic determination of window in computing coordinates by some classes in package datangraphics which yield a complete plot.

      Returns a number with the sign of x and somewhat larger than x with only few significant digits; method is used for automatic determination of window in computing coordinates by some classes in package datangraphics which yield a complete plot.

    • Method Detail

      • openWorkstation

        public static void openWorkstation(java.lang.String frametitle)
        Creates a new, initially invisible DatanGraphicsFrame with the specified title
        Parameters:
        frameTitle - title of DatanGraphicsFrame; if frameTitle is blank the no DatanGraphicsFrame is initialized.

      • openWorkstation

        public static void openWorkstation(java.lang.String frameTitle,
                   java.lang.String filename)
        Creates a new, initially invisible DatanGraphicsFrame with the specified title. In addition, a file is initialized into which the graphics is written in Postscript format.
        Parameters:
        frameTitle - title of DatanGraphicsFrame; if frameTitle is blank the no DatanGraphicsFrame is initialized.
        filename - name of Postscript file - has to end with either ".ps" (for postscript) or ".eps" (for encapsulated postscript). If filename is blank, no file is initialized.

      • closeWorkstation

        public static void closeWorkstation()
        Finalizes graphics, displays DatanGraphicsFrame (if one was opened), and closes Postscript file (if one was opened).

      • setWindowInComputingCoordinates

        public static void setWindowInComputingCoordinates(double xacc,
                                   double xbcc,
                                   double yacc,
                                   double ybcc)
        Establishes a window in computing coordiates. Remark: Unreasonable input values are replaced by values that are as reasonable as possible. E.g., if xacc == xbcc, then the method takes xbcc to be xacc + 1.
        Parameters:
        xacc - lower window edge in x
        xbcc - upper window edge in x
        yacc - lower window edge in y
        ybcc - upper window edge in y

      • setWindowInWorldCoordinates

        public static void setWindowInWorldCoordinates(double xapwc,
                               double xbpwc,
                               double yapwc,
                               double ybpwc)
        Establishes a window in world coordiates. Remark: Unreasonable input values are replaced by values that are as reasonable as possible. E.g., if xapwc == xbpwc, then the method takes xbpwc to be xapwc + 1.
        Parameters:
        xapwc - lower window edge in x
        xbpwc - upper window edge in x
        yapwc - lower window edge in y
        ybpwc - upper window edge in y

      • setViewportInWorldCoordinates

        public static void setViewportInWorldCoordinates(double xawc,
                                 double xbwc,
                                 double yawc,
                                 double ybwc)
        Establishes a viewport in world coordiates. Remark: Unreasonable input values are replaced by values that are as reasonable as possible. E.g., if xawc == xbwc, then the method takes xbwc to be xawc + 1.
        Parameters:
        xawc - lower viewport edge in x
        xbwc - upper viewport edge in x
        yawc - lower viewport edge in y
        ybwc - upper viewport edge in y

      • chooseColor

        public static void chooseColor(int colorIndex)
        Chooses a color index, determining the color of all graphics elements created after this choice until it is changed.
        Parameters:
        colorindex - index in color table; has to be >=1, <=8 for method to be effective

      • drawContour

        public static void drawContour(double x0,
               double y0,
               double dx,
               double dy,
               int nx,
               int ny,
               double fcont,
               DatanUserFunction cuf)
        Draws the contour line f(x,y) = c of a function f as a series of line segments in the x,y plane.
        Parameters:
        x0,dx,nx - initial value, interval width and number of intervals for dividing the x axis
        y0,dy,ny - same the y axis
        fcont - function value c of the contour line
        cuf - user function computing f(x,y) which must be an extension of DatanUserFunction

      • drawCaption

        public static void drawCaption(double scalef,
               java.lang.String string)
        Draws a caption appearing just under the upper edge of the window in world coordinates.
        Parameters:
        scalef - scale factor; the typical length of a dash is 1% of the picture diagonal multiplied by this factor
        string - string containing the encoded text of the caption

      • drawText

        public static void drawText(double x,
            double y,
            double scalef,
            java.lang.String string)
        Draws a text appearing at a desired position.
        Parameters:
        x,y - computing coordinate designating the lower left-hand corner of the rectangle surrounding the text
        scalef - scale factor; the typical length of a dash is 1% of the picture diagonal multiplied by this factor
        string - string containing the encoded text

      • drawHistogram

        public static void drawHistogram(Histogram histogram)
        Draws a histogram
        Parameters:
        histogram - the histogram to be drawn

      • drawDatapoint

        public static void drawDatapoint(int nmark,
                 double scalef,
                 double x,
                 double y,
                 double sigmax,
                 double sigmay,
                 double rho)
        Draws a data point with bars, and covariance ellipse
        Parameters:
        nmark - form of polymarker symbolizing the data point (1: open circle, 2: closed circle, 3: open sqare, 4: closed sqare, 5: open diamond, 6: closed diamond, 7: +, 8: x. 9: *)
        scalef - scale factor; the diameter of the polymarker is 1% of the picture diagonal multiplied by this factor
        x - x coordinate of data point
        y - y coordinate of data point
        deltax - error in x; error bar is drawn only if deltax > 0 and if its siye would exceed the radius if the polymarker
        deltay - error in y; error bar is drawn only if deltax > 0 and if its siye would exceed the radius if the polymarker
        rho - correlation between errors; covariance ellipse is not drawn if rho = 0 (drawing can be forced by giveng nmark a negative sign)

      • drawMark

        public static void drawMark(int nmark,
            double scalef,
            double xpm,
            double ypm)
        Draws a polymarker
        Parameters:
        nmark - form of polymarker (1: open circle, 2: closed circle, 3: open sqare, 4: closed sqare, 5: open diamond, 6: closed diamond, 7: +, 8: x. 9: *)
        scalef - scale factor; the diameter of the polymarker is 1% of the picture diagonal multiplied by this factor
        xpm - x coordinate of polymarker
        ypm - y coordinate of polymarker

      • drawPolyline

        public static void drawPolyline(double[] xpl,
                double[] ypl)
        Draws a polyline.
        Parameters:
        xpl - x-coordinates of polyline
        ypl - y-coordinates of polyline

      • drawBrokenPolyline

        public static void drawBrokenPolyline(int ntype,
                      double scalef,
                      double[] xpl,
                      double[] ypl)
        Draws a broken polyline.
        Parameters:
        ntype - line type (1: dashed, 2: dotted, 3 dot-dashed)
        scalef - scale factor; the typical length of a dash is 1% of the picture diagonal multiplied by this factor
        xpl - x-coordinates of polyline
        ypl - y-coordinates of polyline

      • drawBoundary

        public static void drawBoundary()
        Draws a frame around the computing coordinates window.

      • drawCoordinateCross

        public static void drawCoordinateCross()
        Draws the axes of the computing-coordinate system as dashed lines within the window of computing coordiates.

      • drawFrame

        public static void drawFrame()
        Draws a frame around the window in the world coordinate system.

      • setFormat

        public static void setFormat(double width,
             double height)
        Determines the Format of the plot. Remarks: If plot too large for size of paper or screen frame, it is reduced in size to fit.
        Parameters:
        width - width of plot in centimetres; if height=0, then plot has landscape A format with width being A number, e.g. (widhth=5, height=0) stands for landscape A5
        height - height of plot in centimetres; if = width=0, then plot has portrait A format with height being A number, e.g. (widhth=0, height=5) stands for portrait A5. If both width=0 and height=0, then the format is set to landscape A5.

      • setSmallClippingWindow

        public static void setSmallClippingWindow()
        Sets the clipping window to be the window of the computing coordinates.

      • setBigClippingWindow

        public static void setBigClippingWindow()
        Sets the clipping window to be the frame of the entire plot.

      • drawScaleX

        public static void drawScaleX(java.lang.String string)
        Draws an axis in x-direction. Remark: Tick marks from the upper and lower edges of the computing-coordinate window are drawn inside the window. Below the lower edge, numbers are displayed which label some of these marks. It is recommended to first call the method drawBoundary() to display lines on the window edges. The ticks and numbers are created automatically based on the choice of world and computing coordinates; they can be determined explicitely by the user by calling setParametersForScale(...) before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        string - encoded text appearing at arrow tip accompanying the scale

      • drawScaleY

        public static void drawScaleY(java.lang.String string)
        Draws an axis in y-direction. Remark: Tick marks from the left and right edges of the computing-coordinate window are drawn inside the window. To the left of the left edge, numbers are displayed which label some of these marks. It is recommended to first call the method drawBoundary() to display lines on the window edges. The ticks and numbers are created automatically based on the choice of world and computing coordinates; they can be determined explicitely by the user by calling setParametersForScale(...) before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        string - encoded text appearing at arrow tip accompanying the scale

      • setParametersForScale

        public static void setParametersForScale(double fix,
                         double del,
                         int ntic,
                         double ticscale,
                         double numberscale,
                         boolean lnum)
        Sets user defined properties for the scale drawn by the next call of drawScaleX or drawScaleY.
        Parameters:
        fix - value (in computing coordinates) which one wants to mark and label with a number on the axis
        del - distance between labeled tick marks
        ntic - number of intervals with smaller tic marks between two labeled tick marks
        ticscale - scale factor for tic length
        numberscale - scale factor for numbers
        lnum - defines wether the numbers on the axes are shown ind decimal (lnum=true) or exponential form (lnum=false)

      • setStandardPaperSizeAndBorders

        public static void setStandardPaperSizeAndBorders()
        Sets paper size to A4 format and all boders to 0.5 cm.

      • setPaperSizeAndBorders

        public static void setPaperSizeAndBorders(double paperwidth,
                          double paperheight,
                          double borderleft,
                          double borderright,
                          double borderbottom,
                          double bordertop)
        Sets paper size and distances of used area from paper edge; if not called A4 format is assumed with 0.5 cm for all boders.
        Parameters:
        paperwidth - width of paper in cm
        paperheight - height of paper in cm
        borderleft - distance of used area from left edge in cm
        borderright - distance of used area from right edge in cm
        bordertop - distance of used area from top edge in cm
        borderbottom - distance of used area from bottom edge in cm

      • setStandardScreenColors

        public static void setStandardScreenColors()
        Assigns standard color and linewidth values to all color indices for screen plots; also assigns standard color to screen plot background.

        Background: Color(0.f, 0.f, .9f)

        color index 1: Color(1.f, 1.f, 0.f), line width 2.f

        color index 2: Color(1.f, 1.f, 1.f), line width 2.f

        color index 3: Color(0.f, 1.f, 1.f), line width 2.f

        color index 4: Color(1.f, 0.784f, 0.f), line width 2.f

        color index 5: Color(1.f, 0.f, 0.f), line width 2.f

        color index 6: Color(0.753f, 0.753f, 0.753f), line width 2.f

        color index 7: Color(0.f, 1.f, 0.f), line width 2.f

        color index 8: Color(1.f, 0.f, 1.f), line width 2.f

      • setScreenColor

        public static void setScreenColor(int index,
                  java.awt.Color color,
                  float linewidth)
        Assigns color and linewidth to a color indesx for screen plots.
        Parameters:
        index - color index (>=1, <=8)
        color - color to be assigned
        linewidth - line width (standard value is 2.f)

      • setScreenBackground

        public static void setScreenBackground(java.awt.Color color)
        Assigns a color to the background of screen plots.

      • setStandardPSColors

        public static void setStandardPSColors()
        Assigns standard color and linewidth values to all color indices for Postscript plots.

        Background: Color.white

        color index 1: Color(0.f, 0.f, 1.f), line width 2.f

        color index 2: Color(0.f, 0.f, 0.f), line width 2.f

        color index 3: Color(0.f, 1.f, 0.f), line width 2.f

        color index 4: Color(1.f, 0.f, 0.f), line width 2.f

        color index 5: Color(1.f, 0.f, 0.f), line width 2.f

        color index 6: Color(.70f, 0.f, 0.75f), line width 2.f

        color index 7: Color(0.f, 1.f, 0.f), line width 2.f

        color index 8: Color(1.f, 0.f, 1.f), line width 2.f

      • setPSColor

        public static void setPSColor(int index,
              java.awt.Color color,
              float linewidth)
        Assigns color and linewidth to a color indesx for Postscript plots plots.
        Parameters:
        index - color index (>=1, <=8)
        color - color to be assigned
        linewidth - line width (standard value is 2.f)

      • setStandardPSColorsBlackAndWhite

        public static void setStandardPSColorsBlackAndWhite()
        Assigns standard color and linewidth values to all color indices for Postscript plots in black-and-white.

        Background: Color.white

        color index 1 to 8: Color.black, line width 2.f

      • roundUp

        public static double roundUp(double x)
        Returns a number with the sign of x and somewhat larger than x with only few significant digits; method is used for automatic determination of window in computing coordinates by some classes in package datangraphics which yield a complete plot.

      • roundDown

        public static double roundDown(double x)
        Returns a number with the sign of x and somewhat smaller than x with only few significant digits; method is used for automatic determination of window in computing coordinates by some classes in package datangraphics which yield a complete plot.
